intro: Costularia falcifolia, commonly known as the sickleleaf costularia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, sickle-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in umbels, which bloom during the wet season. Costularia falcifolia is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories or along stream banks.
